person.persName: James Brown Clay (Fayette County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, farmer. Washington, D.C. native. Son of Henry Clay and Lucretia Hart Clay. Married to Susan M. Clay. Father of Lucy J. Clay, James B. Clay, J. C. J. Clay, Harry Clay, Lucritia Clay, Thomas J. Clay, Susan J. Clay, Charles D. Clay, and George Clay. Graduated from Transylvania University in Lexington, Kentucky in 1841. Attorney in Lexington from 1841 to 1849. Charges d'Affaires to Portugal from 1849 to 1850. Member of the House of Representative of the United States from 1857 to 1859. Farmer in Fayette County in 1860.
